description: Turn your potato skins into crispy, cheesy dippers for a zingy tomato and jalapeno salsa, perfect for a Friday night movie treat.
keywords: Appetisers,Pescatarian,Seafood free,Gluten free,Tree nut free,Egg free,Jun 2021,Winter,Low sugar,Sesame free,Potato,Halal,High protein,High fibre,Soy free,Wheat free,Vegetarian,Autumn,Tomato,Peanut free
name: Spicy Potato Skins with Salsa Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 220°C/200°C fan-forced. Spread salt evenly over base of a deep 20 x 30cm baking dish. Using a fork, pierce each potato 5 times. Place potatoes on salt. Cover with foil and bake for 1 hour or until tender when pierced with a small knife.
When cool enough to handle, halve potatoes lengthways. Scoop out potato flesh with a spoon and reserve for another use (see Potato rolls or Perfect mashed potato). Discard salt.

Line a baking tray with baking paper. Place potato skins, cut-sides up, on tray. Spray with oil and bake for 30 minutes, sprinkling with mozzarella in the last 10 minutes of baking, or until golden and crisp.
Meanwhile, combine tomato, onion, coriander, jalapeno chilli and lime juice in a bowl. Serve potato skins topped with salsa and sour cream, and seasoned with pepper.
